meaning: an indefinite article used to indicate a noun or noun phrase
example: the apple
note: used as an indefinite article in English to refer to a specific thing without specifying what it is

meaning: relating to or concerning something
example: This movie is about a group of friends who travel the world.

meaning: completely, entire
example: I have all the necessary materials.

meaning: in addition to something else; also
example: I like coffee and tea.

meaning: a conjunction used to connect words, phrases, or clauses in a sentence
example: I like and hate coffee.

meaning: in the same manner, degree or amount as something else.
example: He plays soccer as well as basketball.

meaning: in a location or position; on something
example: She put her book at the top of the shelf.
note: Preposition of place, indicating location or direction.

meaning: to exist or have a quality
example: She is a good singer.

meaning: reason or cause for something
example: I'm going to the movies because I want to see a new movie.

meaning: used to indicate a contrast or exception, often used to introduce a negative statement.
example: I wanted to go, but I had other plans.

meaning: with the help of or using something as an instrument
example: The teacher used a ruler by her side to measure the length of the paper.

meaning: capable of being used for a particular purpose
example: She can sing beautifully.
note: can is used to indicate ability or capability

meaning: to move towards someone or something
example: She will come to the party tonight.

meaning: can or may be done
example: She could speak English fluently.
note: Used to express possibility or ability

meaning: a period of time between sunrise and sunset, especially as a unit of time used in calendars.
example: I love spending my days at the beach.

meaning: to accomplish or perform something
example: She has to do her homework tonight.

meaning: being equal in amount, degree, or value
example: She has an even smile.

meaning: to discover or locate something
example: She will find the book on the shelf.

meaning: initial or primary in order, time, or degree
example: The first day of school was a big success.

meaning: used to indicate purpose or intention
example: I'm doing this for you

meaning: originating from a place or person
example: I am from New York.

meaning: to obtain or acquire something
example: I will get a coffee from the café.

meaning: to provide or supply something to someone or something
example: Can you give me a cup of water?

meaning: to move or travel from one place to another
example: I want to go to the store.
note: Can be a command or an action verb

meaning: to possess or hold something
example: I have a dog.

meaning: a person considered as the subject of a sentence or clause, especially when referring to himself or herself
example: John is he.

meaning: relating to or characteristic of a female person or animal; belonging to her; intended for or affecting only females
example: The dress was designed for her.

meaning: Beloved or dear one
example: She is my aziza.

meaning: the person or animal referred to by the pronoun he or she
example: He is a great friend of his.

meaning: belonging to him
example: That's his car.

meaning: in what way or manner
example: I want to know how you did it.

meaning: to what end or purpose
example: I'm not sure why I feel this way.
This is a sentence with the word I.

meaning: used to indicate a condition or circumstance
example: I will go if the weather permits.

meaning: within or inside something; being contained within a surface
example: She looked in the mirror.

meaning: in a place where something is or is put into
example: She put the book into the bag.

meaning: an object, person, or thing
example: She is reading it.

meaning: belonging to it or its possessive pronoun
example: The cat chases its tail.

meaning: correct, fair, reasonable, appropriate
example: She felt that the punishment was just.
note: Can be used as an adjective or adverb.

meaning: to be aware of or to have knowledge of something
example: I know how to ride a bike.

meaning: to have a preference for something
example: I like ice cream

meaning: to see or glance at something
example: She took a look around the room.

meaning: to produce or create something
example: She makes a great cup of coffee.

meaning: an adult male human being
example: a tall man with a beard entered the restaurant

meaning: a large or numerous quantity of something
example: I have many books on my shelf.

meaning: belonging to or identified with the speaker or addressee of a sentence, question, or utterance
example: I'm going to the store for me and my friend.

meaning: a greater amount or degree
example: I need more milk.

meaning: belonging to me
example: That's my book.

meaning: recently created or experienced; existing for the first time
example: I just got a new phone.

meaning: used to indicate refusal or denial
example: I don't want to go.

meaning: used for negation, opposite of something
example: I don't like ice cream.

meaning: at this time, present moment
example: I will meet you now.

meaning: used to indicate a relationship of involvement, possession, or origin.
example: She is the daughter of John.

meaning: being on something, having a position or location
example: She placed the phone on the table.

meaning: a single entity or unit of quantity, amount, etc.
example: I need one apple for the pie.

meaning: sole or exclusive
example: She is the only one who can help.

meaning: used to indicate a choice between two or more things, to show that something is true, or to indicate a possibility
example: Do you want coffee or tea?

meaning: not one of the others; unlike
example: I want the other book.

meaning: belonging to us, something shared or enjoyed by a group of people
example: We are going on vacation our week.

meaning: moving from a place or situation to another
example: I'm going out for dinner.

meaning: A group of human beings
example: The people in the park were playing games.

meaning: to express or communicate something
example: She says she's happy.

meaning: to perceive with the eyes or to understand
example: I can see the Eiffel Tower from here.

meaning: the female subject of a sentence or the object of a verb
example: She is going to the store.

meaning: used to indicate agreement or confirmation, especially when talking about something that is obvious or has already been mentioned.
example: That's so cool!

meaning: a small amount or quantity
example: I ate some food for breakfast.

meaning: to receive something given to you, or to move your hand towards something
example: Can I take my phone?

meaning: to communicate or share information verbally
example: She told me about her new job.

meaning: used for comparison
example: He is taller than I am.

meaning: used to introduce a person or thing
example: I like that book.

meaning: a definite article used to refer to a specific person, place, or thing
example: I want the book on the table.

meaning: belonging to them, used as possessive pronoun after a singular or plural noun
example: Their car is red.

meaning: people or things regarded as the subject of a sentence
example: They are going to the store.
note: Used for plural subjects or objects.

meaning: in that case, next
example: I'll meet you then.

meaning: indicating a place or direction
example: Put the book over there on the table.

meaning: used to refer to things previously mentioned or easily identified
example: I'm going to these movies with you.

meaning: used to refer to people or animals, especially as a group of three or more
example: She is going to meet them at the store.

meaning: a person, place, or thing of interest or importance
example: The new smartphone is a great thing.

meaning: to consider or reflect on something carefully and wisely
example: She takes a moment to think before making a decision.

meaning: Used to refer to something or someone near the speaker, a specific time or event, etc.
example: Can you pass me this book?

meaning: used to refer to a group of people or things that are already known or mentioned
example: I want to go to those places I visited last year.

meaning: the measure of the duration between events or periods
example: I have a meeting at 2 o'clock.
note: a unit of time is usually measured in minutes, seconds or hours

meaning: in the direction of or destination
example: She's going to the store.

meaning: a numerical value indicating the quantity of 2
example: I have two apples.

meaning: in a direction vertically upwards or to an upper position
example: She walked up the stairs.

meaning: to employ or utilize something for a particular purpose
example: She will use the computer to finish her project.

meaning: to a great degree or extent
example: She is very happy.

meaning: to have a desire or wish for something
example: I want to go to the beach.

meaning: a path or route
example: She chose her way through the forest.
note: Can be a metaphor for life's journey or a method of doing something.

meaning: plural form of 'us'
example: They are with us.

meaning: in a good or satisfactory manner
example: a source of fresh water

meaning: used to ask for information or explanation about something
example: I want to know what's going on.

meaning: at what time
example: I will meet you when the bus arrives.

meaning: used to ask for examples or specify which one
example: Which book did you read?

meaning: a person or people
example: Who is going to the party?

meaning: future tense of 'can' or 'shall'
example: I will go to the movies tonight.

meaning: accompanied by
example: She is with her friends.

meaning: past tense of will or could, used to express possibility or necessity
example: I would have gone if I had known about it.
note: can be replaced with 'could' in some cases

meaning: A period of time that has passed or is about to pass, typically measured in years.
example: I will celebrate my birthday next year.

meaning: the person or people being addressed or referred to
example: How are you doing today?

meaning: belonging to you, indicating possession or belonging
example: That is your book.
